snippet: Despite Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s election victory, he is still out of the good graces of the Obama administration, which has had to reassess its policy toward Israel.
abstract: Obama administration has sharpened its tone toward Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, signaling that it is in no hurry to repair historic rift between two countries, despite Netanyahu's electoral victory; shift underlines two calculations on part of administration, namely that deal with Iran over its nuclear program is achievable and that Democratic Jewish voters are also upset with Netanyahu for inflammatory comments made while campaigning.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Despite Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s election victory, he is still out of the good graces of the Obama administration, which has had to reassess its policy toward Israel.

headline.main: White House Antagonism Toward Netanyahu Grows
headline.print_headline: At White House, a Sharper Tone With Netanyahu
